question: Question_05_(b)
statement:
Consider an internet with six sites. The stochastic matrix describing
the behaviour of a web surfer (with damping factor zero) is

\[P = \begin{bmatrix}
0 & 0 & \frac13 & 0 & 0 & 0 \\
\frac12 & 0 & \frac13 & 0 & 0 & 0 \\
0 & \frac13 & 0 & 0 & 0 & \frac12 \\
\frac12 & \frac13 & 0 & 0 & \frac12 & 0 \\
0 & \frac13 & 0 & 1 & 0 & \frac12 \\
0 & 0 & \frac13 & 0 & \frac12 & 0
\end{bmatrix}\]

\textbf{(b)} If we begin with equal probabilities of being at each site,
what are the probabilities of being at each site after one step? What is
the probability of being at site 6 after two steps?
